definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: Any yogis who wishes to stay in this hermitage must accept and comply to the following terms.
sentences.chinese: 任何修行者想在本禪院修行都必須遵守以下條規。

sentences.english: Obviously, rules help us to live in harmony with one another.
sentences.chinese: 顯然的，條規幫助我們與別人和諧共處。

sentences.english: May I show you the regulations?
sentences.chinese: 我可以出示給您那些條規嗎？

sentences.english: This and " criminal law " the 34th regulation is abhorrent.
sentences.chinese: 這與《刑法》第34條規定不一致。

sentences.english: Perhaps you would read the regulations.
sentences.chinese: 或許您要讀一讀那些條規。

sentences.english: Article 217 of penal law stipulates that four actions are infringement of copyright.
sentences.chinese: 刑法第217條規定了四種侵犯著作權的犯罪行爲。

sentences.english: Any subsidy falling under the provisions of Article 3 shall be deemed to be specific.
sentences.chinese: 任何屬第3條規定範圍內的補貼應被視爲專向性補貼。

sentences.english: After order means you have agree the above conditions.
sentences.chinese: 下了訂單就相等於您已閱讀並同意以上所有條規。

sentences.english: I've planned each charted course, each careful step along the byway .
sentences.chinese: 我計劃了每條規劃的路線，一路上每個小心的腳步。

sentences.english: It appears that two particular misconceptions about Incoterms are very common.
sentences.chinese: 它呈現著對於國貿條規二種個別的誤解是非常普遍。

definition: to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
